query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Luogo è in inferno detto Malebolge, 2 tutto di pietra di color ferrigno, 3 come la cerchia che dintorno il volge.
query.result:
**English:**
1 There is a place in Hell called Malebolge, 2 made entirely of iron-colored stone, 3 like the circle that surrounds it.
**Cornish:**
1 Le mayth y'n Ufern gelwys Malebolge, 2 oll a-dhyworth karrek liv tewl, 3 kepar an kelgh a wra a-dro dhodho.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 Nel dritto mezzo del campo maligno 5 vaneggia un pozzo assai largo e profondo, 6 di cui suo loco dicerò l’ordigno.
query.result:
**English:**
4 In the exact center of the evil plain 5 gapes a well, very wide and deep, 6 whose structure I will describe in its proper place.
**Cornish:**
4 Yn kres an park dowr, 5 yma putel meur ha downder, 6 y'n furv a wra'f yth leverys yn le.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Quel cinghio che rimane adunque è tondo 8 tra ’l pozzo e ’l piè de l’alta ripa dura, 9 e ha distinto in dieci valli il fondo.
query.result:
**English:**
7 The remaining encircling bank is therefore round, 8 between the well and the foot of the hard, high cliff, 9 and its base is divided into ten valleys.
**Cornish:**
7 An keth a wra ow kul yw tròn, 8 ynter an putel ha kres an garow ughel kalet, 9 ha deg dol ow rannys y'n isel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Quale, dove per guardia de le mura 11 più e più fossi cingon li castelli, 12 la parte dove son rende figura,
13 tale imagine quivi facean quelli; 14 e come a tai fortezze da’ lor sogli 15 a la ripa di fuor son ponticelli,
16 così da imo de la roccia scogli 17 movien che ricidien li argini e ’ fossi 18 infino al pozzo che i tronca e raccogli.
query.result:
**English:**
10 Like the place where, to guard the walls, 11 castles are encircled by more and more moats, 12 the part where they are situated forms a figure,
13 so here those [valleys] made a similar image; 14 and as from their thresholds to such fortresses 15 there are little bridges to the outer bank,
16 so from the bottom of the rock, spurs 17 jutted out, which cut across the banks and moats 18 all the way to the well, which truncates and collects them.
**Cornish:**
10 Kepar an le mayth rag gwitha an mogerow, 11 moy ha moy fossow a wra a-dro dhe'n kastillow, 12 an rann ranndir ymonsa figyer,
13 henna figyer a wra gwres gans an re, 14 ha kepar dhe'n kastillow magh an fordhow 15 dhe'n garow a-ves yma ponsyow byghan,
16 hemma a-dhyworth isel an garow, karrygi 17 a wra a-dhyworth ow kul ha'n argow ha'n fossow 18 bys dhe'n putel ow tronk ha'n dassober.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 In questo luogo, de la schiena scossi 20 di Gerïon, trovammoci; e ’l poeta 21 tenne a sinistra, e io dietro mi mossi.
query.result:
**English:**
19 In this place, from the back we slid 20 of Geryon, we found ourselves; and the poet 21 kept to the left, and I moved behind.
**Cornish:**
19 Yn le maynma, a-dhyworth y gevelyn, 20 a Gerïon, ny yth aswon; ha'n bardh 21 a dheuth dhe'n klew, ha my a dheuth dhe'y gevelyn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 A la man destra vidi nova pieta, 23 novo tormento e novi frustatori, 24 di che la prima bolgia era repleta.
query.result:
**English:**
22 On the right hand I saw a new woe, 23 a new torment and new tormentors, 24 with which the first ditch was replete.**Cornish:**
22 War-lergh y dhehoo, gweles vy anoweth poen, 23 anoweth poennoweth frustratorow noweth, 24 hag an kynsa bolgia o perthi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Nel fondo erano ignudi i peccatori; 26 dal mezzo in qua ci venien verso ’l volto, 27 di là con noi, ma con passi maggiori,
28 come i Roman per l’essercito molto, 29 l’anno del giubileo, su per lo ponte 30 hanno a passar la gente modo colto,
31 che da l’un lato tutti hanno la fronte 32 verso ’l castello e vanno a Santo Pietro, 33 da l’altra sponda vanno verso ’l monte.
query.result:
**English:**
25 At the bottom, the sinners were naked; 26 from the middle on, they came towards us, 27 on our side, but with longer strides,
28 like the Romans during the great jubilee, 29 cross the bridge, they have a clever way 30 of letting people cross,
31 so that on one side they all have their faces 32 towards the castle and go to Saint Peter's, 33 while on the other side they go towards the mountain.
**Cornish:**
25 Yn-dann oedh an pechoryon noeth, 26 a-dhyworth an kres dheuthens dhe'n drehev, 27 war-lergh gansow, mes gans kammow moy,
28 kepar ha'n Romanow rag an lu heer meur, 29 yn vledhen an jübileow, war-barth an pons 30 yns i a-dhyworth passya an bobel a-dhyworth fordh,
31 pub tra an tu-hyn ow talleth aga hanter 32 dhe'n kastel ha mos dhe Sen Peder, 33 a-dhyworth an tu-arall yns mos dhe'n menydh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Di qua, di là, su per lo sasso tetro 35 vidi demon cornuti con gran ferze, 36 che li battien crudelmente di retro.
query.result:
**English:**
34 On this side and that, up on the dark rock, 35 I saw horned demons with great whips, 36 who beat them cruelly from behind.
**Cornish:**
34 A-mann, a-benn, war-barth an garrek tewl, 35 mi a welas demonyow kernys gans ferjyon meur, 36 owth a-dhillas yn krueleth a-dhyworth an keffrys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Ahi come facean lor levar le berze 38 a le prime percosse! già nessuno 39 le seconde aspettava né le terze.
query.result:
**English:**
37 Ah, how they made their heels fly 38 at the first blows! No one 39 waited for the second or the third.
**Cornish:**
37 Ah, kepar ow a wrello aga hedhow 38 dhe'n kynsa kowethow! Nyns esa neb 39 ow a-aswonta an nessa po'th an tresya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Mentr’ io andava, li occhi miei in uno 41 furo scontrati; e io sì tosto dissi: 42 «Già di veder costui non son digiuno».
query.result:
**English:**
40 While I was walking, my eyes met 41 someone's; and I said at once: 42 "I am not new to seeing this man".
**Cornish:**
40 Tra ve'm oedh ow mos, aga hedhow yn unn 41 a veu kevys; ha my a leveris yn skon: 42 "Nyns yw nowydh dhyn vy gweles an den-ma".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Per ch’ïo a figurarlo i piedi affissi; 44 e ’l dolce duca meco si ristette, 45 e assentio ch’alquanto in dietro gissi.
query.result:
**English:**
43 Because of which I stopped to look at his feet; 44 and my gentle guide stopped with me, 45 and agreed that I should go back a little.
**Cornish:**
43 Rag henna i a-figurya aga hedhow fast; 44 ha'n dowr jentyl gansow a sevis, 45 ha kenjea vy dhe'm mos dhe'n keffrys unn byghan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 E quel frustato celar si credette 47 bassando ’l viso; ma poco li valse, 48 ch’io dissi: «O tu che l’occhio a terra gette,
49 se le fazion che porti non son false, 50 Venedico se’ tu Caccianemico.
query.result:
**English:**
46 And that whipped man thought to hide himself 47 by lowering his face; but it availed him little, 48 for I said: "O you who cast your eyes to the ground,
49 if the features that you bear are not false, 50 you are Venedico Caccianemico.
**Cornish:**
46 Ha'n den-ma frustyes a grysis kovul 47 gans bassya aga edhen; mes byghan a-valyas, 48 rag my a leveris: "O ty ow a-dhrulha aga hedhen dhe'n nor,
49 mar nyns yw an fasow ow porthys gen fals, 50 Venedico se'thys ty Caccianemico.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
51 Ma che ti mena a sì pungenti salse?».
52 Ed elli a me: «Mal volontier lo dico; 53 ma sforzami la tua chiara favella, 54 che mi fa sovvenir del mondo antico.
query.result:
**English:**
51 But what brings you to such pungent sauces?".
52 And he said to me: "I tell you unwillingly; 53 but your clear speech compels me, 54 which makes me remember the ancient world.
**Cornish:**
51 Mes pyth a-dhug dhe'n salsyow pungentek kepar-ma?".
52 Ha henna dhymmo dhyn: "Yn dhysempys loth my a lever; 53 mes owth aga favella kler owth a-forsys vy, 54 ow a wra aga kovsow an bys vyth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 I’ fui colui che la Ghisolabella 56 condussi a far la voglia del marchese, 57 come che suoni la sconcia novella.
query.result:
**English:**
55 I was the one who led Ghisolabella 56 to do the will of the marquis, 57 however the ugly story may sound.
**Cornish:**
55 My veu an hini a-ledhas Ghisolabella 56 dhe wul an volons an markis, 57 kepar ha'n hanow an novella sconk.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 E non pur io qui piango bolognese; 59 anzi n’è questo loco tanto pieno, 60 che tante lingue non son ora apprese
61 a dicer ‘sipa’ tra Sàvena e Reno; 62 e se di ciò vuoi fede o testimonio, 63 rècati a mente il nostro avaro seno».
query.result:
**English:**
58 And I am not the only Bolognese weeping here; 59 on the contrary, this place is so full of them, 60 that there are not so many tongues now learned
61 to say 'yes' between the Savena and the Reno; 62 and if you want proof or testimony of this, 63 call to mind our avaricious nature".
**Cornish:**
58 Ha nyns yw vy an unnik Bolognese owth a-wela ama; 59 mes yn-dann yw an le ma plen, 60 na'n syw kemmyskeeth yethow lemmyn owth a-dhyskons
61 dhe leverel 'sipa' ynter Savena ha Reno; 62 ha mar owth a-vynn feth po testeneth a-dro dhe henna, 63 kovsow dhe'n poynt aga kolon avarus".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Così parlando il percosse un demonio 65 de la sua scurïada, e disse: «Via, 66 ruffian! qui non son femmine da conio».
query.result:
**English:**
64 As he spoke, a demon struck him 65 with his whip, and said: "Get out of here, 66 pimp! There are no women here to mint".
**Cornish:**
64 Tra ve'm ow leverel an demon a-berthas ev 65 gans aga skuriada, ha leveris: "Mos, 66 ruffian! Ama nyns yw benenes dhe goni ama".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 I’ mi raggiunsi con la scorta mia; 68 poscia con pochi passi divenimmo 69 là ’v’ uno scoglio de la ripa uscia.
query.result:
**English:**
67 I rejoined my guide; 68 then with a few steps we came 69 to where a cliff jutted out from the bank.
**Cornish:**
67 Yma'm unys vyth an vy scorta vy; 68 wosa henna gans nebes camow 69 dhe wosa onan scoli a-dhia wort an riva.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Assai leggeramente quel salimmo; 71 e vòlti a destra su per la sua scheggia, 72 da quelle cerchie etterne ci partimmo.
query.result:
**English:**
70 We climbed that easily enough; 71 and, turning to the right, up its broken side, 72 we left those eternal circles.
**Cornish:**
70 Nyns esa esa dhesempis ythoma ni; 71 ha troha dhe'n dhew dhe worto an garm, 72 nyns esa esa dhesempis ythoma ni.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Quando noi fummo là dov’ el vaneggia 74 di sotto per dar passo a li sferzati, 75 lo duca disse: «Attienti, e fa che feggia
76 lo viso in te di quest’ altri mal nati, 77 ai quali ancor non vedesti la faccia 78 però che son con noi insieme andati».
query.result:
**English:**
73 When we were there where he raves 74 from below to give passage to those whipped, 75 the leader said: "Pay attention, and make sure that you strike 76 your gaze upon these other ill-born ones, 77 whose faces you have not yet seen, 78 because they have walked with us all along".
**Cornish:**
73 Pan vynjyth owna drefen ef a'gas 74 a-woles rag tremena dhe'n flagerys, 75 an myghtern a leveris: "Kemmer, ha gweles 76 anedha-ma dhe'n dus-genys-ma, 77 na'gas gweles aga enep 78 rag ev re beu gansow gans anedha".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Del vecchio ponte guardavam la traccia 80 che venìa verso noi da l’altra banda, 81 e che la ferza similmente scaccia.
query.result:
**English:**
79 From the old bridge we watched the trail 80 that came towards us from the other side, 81 and which the whip similarly drives away.
**Cornish:**
79 A-dhia an pons koth a welas an hols 80 ow tos orthynny dhe'n niver a-ban, 81 ha'n flagel a'gas yn kethres an hols.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 E ’l buon maestro, sanza mia dimanda, 83 mi disse: «Guarda quel grande che vene, 84 e per dolor non par lagrime spanda:
85 quanto aspetto reale ancor ritene! 86 Quelli è Iasón, che per cuore e per senno 87 li Colchi del monton privati féne.
query.result:
**English:**
82 And the good master, without my asking, 83 said to me: "Look at that great one who is coming, 84 and for grief does not seem to shed tears:
85 how much royal bearing he still retains! 86 That is Jason, who by heart and by sense 87 made the Colchians bereft of the ram.
**Cornish:**
82 Ha'gas myghtern da, heb ow kov, 83 a leveris: "Sel an brassa onan a dheu, 84 ha rag dolur nyns eus ow weli dewdh:
85 pyth yw y sewyans rouel a with! 86 Henna yw Iason, dre galon ha dre sens 87 a wrug an Golchyon diworth an oen dibenna.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Ello passò per l’isola di Lenno 89 poi che l’ardite femmine spietate 90 tutti li maschi loro a morte dienno.
query.result:
**English:**
88 He passed through the island of Lemnos, 89 after the bold and pitiless women 90 had put all their men to death.
**Cornish:**
88 Etha a drehedhes dre Lemnos 89 wosa'n benenes spiethes kalon 90 a wrug an gwirogoth dhe'n mernans.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Ivi con segni e con parole ornate 92 Isifile ingannò, la giovinetta 93 che prima avea tutte l’altre ingannate.
query.result:
**English:**
91 There, with gestures and ornate words, 92 He deceived her, the young girl 93 who had previously deceived all the others.
**Cornish:**
91 Eno, gans merkva ha gerow treylyes, 92 Ysyfyl a'y gwlaskor, an yowynk, 93 Neb a wra hwath an erel a-ragor.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Con lui sen va chi da tal parte inganna; 98 e questo basti de la prima valle 99 sapere e di color che ’n sé assanna».
query.result:
**English:**
97 With him goes he who deceives in such a way; 98 and this is enough to know of the first valley 99 and of those it ensnares within itself».
**Cornish:**
97 Ganso ev a'n jev neb a wra gwlaskor orth an fordh; 98 Ha henna yw dos orth an kynsa glyn 99 Ragas gwybos ha neb a wra y'n danvon orth y honan».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Già eravam là ’ve lo stretto calle 101 con l’argine secondo s’incrocicchia, 102 e fa di quello ad un altr’ arco spalle.
query.result:
**English:**
100 We were already there where the narrow path 101 intersects with the second bank, 102 and makes a shoulder of that bank to another arch.
**Cornish:**
100 Nyns o ni eno, le mayth an fordh kul 101 A'n fordh nessa gans an argel a-dro, 102 Ha'n fordh nessa a wra golow orth pub argel aral.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Quindi sentimmo gente che si nicchia 104 ne l’altra bolgia e che col muso scuffa, 105 e sé medesma con le palme picchia.
query.result:
**English:**
103 Then we heard people who were huddled together 104 in the other ditch and who were striking their snouts, 105 and beating themselves with their palms.
**Cornish:**
103 Wosa henna nynsons tus a-wrygla 104 yn y volja arall ha'gas a-grymmla aga fronow, 105 ha'gas aga honan a-darow gans aga dorn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Le ripe eran grommate d’una muffa, 107 per l’alito di giù che vi s’appasta, 108 che con li occhi e col naso facea zuffa.
query.result:
**English:**
106 The banks were encrusted with a mold, 107 because of the breath from below that congealed there, 108 which made war with the eyes and the nose.
**Cornish:**
106 An gwernow o an skorras gans un dowr, 107 drefen an alanow a-woles, 108 ow tos an golwg ha'n fron.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Lo fondo è cupo sì, che non ci basta 110 loco a veder sanza montare al dosso 111 de l’arco, ove lo scoglio più sovrasta.
query.result:
**English:**
109 The bottom is so deep that it is not enough for us 110 to see it without climbing to the top 111 of the arch, where the rock juts out the most.
**Cornish:**
109 An gwern yw kledh dhe namyn pes dheugh 110 le a weles heb dalle dhe'n ughella 111 an both, le may an garrek a-ugher.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Quivi venimmo; e quindi giù nel fosso 113 vidi gente attuffata in uno sterco 114 che da li uman privadi parea mosso.
query.result:
**English:**
112 There we came; and then down in the ditch 113 I saw people plunged in excrement 114 that seemed to have been produced by deprived humans.
**Cornish:**
112 Hina a dheuth; ha'gas henna dhe'n fos 113 a weles tus a-woles yn un kas 114 ow tevi drefen tus denel goth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 E mentre ch’io là giù con l’occhio cerco, 116 vidi un col capo sì di merda lordo, 117 che non parëa s’era laico o cherco.
query.result:
**English:**
115 And while I was searching down there with my eyes, 116 I saw someone whose head was so smeared with excrement, 117 that it did not appear whether he was a layman or a cleric.
**Cornish:**
115 Ha travia vy o-woles gans ow lagha, 116 mi a welas unn gans ow ben ow skorras gans tewes, 117 na'th o-welas hag o o laghan po kler.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Quei mi sgridò: «Perché se’ tu sì gordo 119 di riguardar più me che li altri brutti?». 120 E io a lui: «Perché, se ben ricordo,
121 già t’ho veduto coi capelli asciutti, 122 e se’ Alessio Interminei da Lucca: 123 però t’adocchio più che li altri tutti».
query.result:
**English:**
118 He shouted at me: "Why are you staring at me more 119 than at the other wretches?". 120 And I to him: "Because, if I remember correctly,
121 I once saw you with dry hair, 122 and you are Alessio Interminei from Lucca: 123 that's why I'm watching you more than all the others".
**Cornish:**
118 Ev a leveris dhym: "Peragath os dhe'n fordh 119 dhe weles vy moy ages an dus ughella?". 120 Ha my dh'agan: "Rag, marow kov,
121 mi a'th welas gans blewow sygh, 122 ha'th os Alessio Interminei a-Luk: 123 henna rag owth as dhe weles moy ages an dus erell".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Ed elli allor, battendosi la zucca: 125 «Qua giù m’hanno sommerso le lusinghe 126 ond’ io non ebbi mai la lingua stucca».
query.result:
**English:**
124 And he then, beating his head: 125 "Down here I have been drowned by the flatteries 126 that I never tired of uttering".
**Cornish:**
124 Ha henna, ow talleth y ben: 125 "Ama mi a veu bosmeth gans an lowena 126 ow na'th o-fethas vyth ow tavos".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Appresso ciò lo duca «Fa che pinghe», 128 mi disse, «il viso un poco più avante, 129 sì che la faccia ben con l’occhio attinghe
130 di quella sozza e scapigliata fante 131 che là si graffia con l’unghie merdose, 132 e or s’accoscia e ora è in piedi stante.
query.result:
**English:**
127 After that the leader said to me: "Make sure 128 that your face goes a little further forward, 129 so that your eyes can take in well the face
130 of that filthy and disheveled maidservant 131 who is scratching herself there with her filthy nails, 132 and who is now crouching and now standing upright".
**Cornish:**
127 Wosa henna, an ledyer a leveris dhym: "Gwra", 128 ev a leveris dhym, "dhe'n fas dhe'n golwg unn byghan moy, 129 dhe bys dhe'n fas dhe weles yn dha
130 an vorwyn soth ha'gas dilew, 131 owth as ow'n kraffya aga honan gans aga ewynnow tewes, 132 ha'gas owth as ow'n kosha ha'gas owth as ow'n savya yn sevel".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Taïde è, la puttana che rispuose 134 al drudo suo quando disse “Ho io grazie 135 grandi apo te?”: “Anzi maravigliose!”.
query.result:
**English:**
133 She is Thaïs, the whore who answered 134 her lover when he said "Do I have great 135 thanks from you?": "On the contrary, marvelous ones!".
**Cornish:**
133 Taïde yw hi, an whor a leveris 134 dhe'n kar a-dhi pan leveris ev "A'm beu meur ras 135 dhyworth?" "Na, meur ras marasek!".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 E quinci sian le nostre viste sazie».
query.result:
**English:**
136 And with that our eyes were satisfied.
**Cornish:**
136 Ha gans henna o-fethas an golwgow honan.
